newsitem.title: USA: Emisphere gets carrier patent notice.
newsitem.headline: Emisphere gets carrier patent notice.

text.p: Emisphere Technologies Inc said on Tuesday it received a notice of allowance from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office regarding a carrier used in its recent clinical trial for an oral formulation of heparin.
In that trial, the carrier, called P414, orally delivered clinically relevant levels of heparin, a compound used for cardiovascular ailments, the company said.

Emisphere said the U.S. patent would have 66 claims covering the carrier's chemical structure, its combination with other protein and macromolecular drugs and its use in promoting oral delivery of drugs now injected.
The patent was expected to be issued in about three months, the company said.
The carrier could also have applications to deliver other therapeutics, Emisphere said.
The company said it believed its oral heparin product could capture a large share of the antithrombotic and anticoagulant market.
The product was being developed by a joint venture between Emisphere and Elan Corp Plc.
